movements.name: Ancient Art
movements.description: Work has been found in tombs. Began with the invention of writing. Favored drawing over color.

movements.name: Renaissance
movements.description: Began in Italy. Time of economic growth. Da Vinci, Michelangelo, and Raphael represented this era.

movements.name: Baroque
movements.description: This was also the age of Rubens, Rembrandt, Vel√°zquez, and Vermeer. The movement was encouraged by the Catholic Church. Less complex; more realistic.

movements.name: Impressionism
movements.description: Distortion & Exaggeration. Very Bright & Vibrant. Captures images as if they were seen at a glance.

movements.name: Post-Impressionism
movements.description: Flat colors, heavy outline, decorative quality. Based on nature.

movements.name: Expressionism
movements.description: The use of distortion and exaggeration. Dance, cinema, literature, and theatre.

movements.name: Cubism
movements.description: Pablo Picasso and Georges Braque. Began in Paris. Introduced 3-D, used several points of view.

movements.name: Dada
movements.description: Emphasized unpredictability in art. Irreverence was key to their artwork.

movements.name: Pop Art
movements.description: Celebrated everyday objects, soup cans, coke bottles, comic strips, and washing powder. Direct descendant of Dadaism. Bright solid colors, no variation.

movements.name: Op Art
movements.description: Seem to swell and vibrate. 'Optical Art'. Bridget Riley, Heinz Mack, & Victor Vasarely.
